page.title: 12The Life of a Shepherd
page.content: A{Shepherd's life}in 1985 is a 7 day a week job. The year starts in March or April with{lambing}when the day can be 17 or 18 hours long. During this time he tries to save every lamb that is born. He is helped in this with modern medicines and injections which he administers himself. May and June is a time of daily feeding and giving the lambs a monthly worming medicine. July is{shearing time,}usually done by contract shearers. It is also the time when the lambs that are big enough are sent to{market.}September is the month of{sheep sales}when the smallest lambs are sold and replacement{ewes}are bought. The{rams}are put with the ewes in October. Feeding and checking in all winds and weathers are the main winter jobs.
